top_categories.workout_context: Gravel and Tar Classic's New Zealand gravel (70%), Paved roads (30%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 99 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel and Tar Classic's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before February.
66ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At mile 60 of 99, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
At Gravel and Tar Classic, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel and Tar Classic. Train it until it feels boring.
6,562ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel and Tar Classic, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
6,562ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on new Zealand countryside—rolling hills, farmland. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 99 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 99 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gravel and Tar Classic’s 99 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel and Tar Classic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on new zealand countryside—rolling hills, farmland to build confidence. Expect: new zealand gravel (70%), paved roads (30%), rolling hills.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 99 miles of new zealand countryside—rolling hills, farmland in Manawatū-Whanganui, New Zealand.
